Pre-Game Insights: India have dominated Bangladesh in T20Is, having lost just one match against them. However, the last meeting between these two teams at the T20 World Cup was a classic. The players don't forget such matches either.

India ran into some problems against South Africa in their last match, with Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Hardik Pandya getting out trying to pull the ball, while KL Rahul and Deepak Hooda were loose outside the offstump. Only Suryakumar Yadav stood tall, finding little support at the other end as he tried to revive the innings.

Bangladesh, though, wouldn't like to talk about Bangalore 2016, while India would like to believe that they have evolved into a stronger outfit these days. Still, Wednesday's clash has all the makings of a memorable contest given the stakes involved, and how the teams are coming to Adelaide after playing three matches each.
Team news: India (probable): 1 KL Rahul, 2 Rohit Sharma (capt), 3 Virat Kohli, 4 Deepak Hooda, 5 Suryakumar Yadav, 6 Hardik Pandya, 7 Dinesh Karthik (wk), 8 R Ashwin, 9 Mohammed Shami, 10 Bhuvneshwar Kumar, 11 Arshdeep Singh
Eight batters looked superfluous against Zimbabwe as Shakib looked like he needed a fifth bowler. What will Bangladesh choose this time?
Pitch and conditions: The Adelaide Oval is traditionally a high-scoring ground in the Big Bash, particularly under lights. Sides batting first have averaged 170 batting first in night games. The problem, however, is that there's rain forecast for the evening.
Stats and trivia: This is the first T20I between India and Bangladesh since their bilateral series three years ago.

India have won their only T20I at the Adelaide Oval, beating Australia by 37 runs here in 2016. Bangladesh have also won their only international match here, their famous 15-run win over England in the 2015 World Cup.
Suryakumar Yadav is on 935 runs in 2022, and is set to become the second men's batter to get 1000-plus runs in a calendar year.
